meanings.definition: The time between sunset and sunrise.
meanings.sent1: During the nighttide, the stars shine brightly in the sky.
meanings.sent2: I prefer to sleep during the nighttide and wake up early in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The nighttide is when the nocturnal animals come out to play.
meanings.sent4: In the nighttide, the world seems to slow down and embrace tranquility.
meanings.sent5: The nighttide enveloped the town in a blanket of darkness, creating a peaceful atmosphere.

meanings.definition: The period of darkness during the night.
meanings.sent1: The nighttide brought a sense of mystery and quiet to the surroundings.
meanings.sent2: I always feel a bit scared during the nighttide when I'm alone.
meanings.sent3: The nighttide cast eerie shadows on the walls, making everything look spooky.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of the nighttide made her keep all the lights on in the house.
meanings.sent5: The nighttide seemed to swallow up all the sounds, leaving only silence in its wake.

meanings.definition: The ebb and flow of the tide during the night.
meanings.sent1: The nighttide brought in treasures from the sea onto the shore.
meanings.sent2: The fishermen knew the best time to catch fish was during the nighttide.
meanings.sent3: The nighttide played a gentle lullaby as the waves kissed the beach.
meanings.sent4: The nighttide whispered secrets to those who listened closely.
meanings.sent5: The nighttide painted a mesmerizing picture of the ocean's dance under the moonlight.
